page.title: 03WILLIAM TOWRIE CUTT
page.content: William Towrie Cutt, was born on Sanday, in 1898. He was the seventh son of a lobster fisherman and they lived at Kettletoft. He emigrated to Canada at the end of the First World War. There he taught in a remote frontier school in the Peace River district of Alberta. Later he was to write books on the Indian - Orkney settlers of the early days, e.g., 'On The Trail of Long Tom', and 'Carry My Bones Northwest'. His other books:- 'Faraway World', 'Seven for the Sea', 'Message From Arkmae', and 'The Hogboon of Hell', are based on his childhood memories of the life on an Orkney Island. With a donation of money received from Mr. Cutt, before his death, the local community was able to set up a library which is kept in the school premises.
